page.title: 01Dyfi Valley At Cemmaes Road
page.content: Influenced greatly by the river Dyfi the valley runs roughly east to west. from the floor of the valley the managed grassland rises up to 2000 feet. Scattered round the area are small paintings of trees mostly deciduous. The village grew up round the now closed Railway station & the junction of 2 'A' class roads. There is a very small population served by a primary school with a much used community hall, small public house, post office come general store & filling station. The population is striongly insular & very Welsh although there is a number of retired outsiders in the area. Employment is mostly agriculture with many farms in the district. The area is famous for its Salmon fishing in season but catchs are declining with each year.
